citation.title: MapWorks Historic Boston Shoreline
citation.shortDescription: Boundaries of historic shoreline; geography covers the City of Boston and parts of Cambridge, Somerville, Chelsea and Winthrop; time period covers 1630-1995 in a series of temporal snapshots
citation.fullDescription: This dataset represents the extents of Bostonâ€™s historic shoreline. It covers the City of Boston and includes some parts of Cambridge, Somerville, Chelsea and Winthrop. This data is structured as temporal snapshots capturing the shoreline extent at different years. The years included in the dataset are 1635, 1795, 1852, 1880, 1916, 1934, 1950, 1995. Because this data was previously unavailable and heavily requested, when it was re-digitized for the Atlas of Boston History Project, the LMEC reached out to the book project cartographers, in order to preserve the re-vectorized data.
citation.accessCondition: This item is in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use.

temporal.temporalNotes: This data represents the historic state of the Boston shoreline in the year 1995. It was digitally derived in 2019 from born-digital maps published in 1995.

maintenance.maintenanceFrequency: This dataset is not frequently updated

publishedWorks.title: All Over the Map: How Boston Made Itself Bigger
publishedWorks.author: Betsy Mason
